Grain.Do: Warm, cooked whole grains like basmati rice (1/2 cup cooked), quinoa (1/2 cup cooked), amaranth (1/2 cup cooked), oats (1/2 cup cooked). Focus on grounding and nourishing grains.
Grain.Dont: Dry, cold, and light grains like puffed rice, crackers, excessive amounts of barley. Avoid refined flours like white bread and pasta.

Legume.Do: Well-cooked and easily digestible legumes like moong dal (1/2 cup cooked), red lentils (1/2 cup cooked), small amounts of black beans (1/4 cup cooked). Soaking and sprouting can improve digestibility.
Legume.Dont: Large, dry, and gas-producing legumes like chickpeas, kidney beans, soybeans in large quantities. Avoid raw or undercooked legumes.

Veg.Do: Cooked, warm, and grounding vegetables like sweet potatoes (1/2 cup cooked), carrots (1/2 cup cooked), beets (1/4 cup cooked), zucchini (1/2 cup cooked), squash (1/2 cup cooked).
Veg.Dont: Raw, cold, and bitter vegetables like raw salads, broccoli, cauliflower, Brussels sprouts in excess. Avoid extremely bitter or pungent vegetables.

Spices.Do: Warming and digestive spices like ginger (1/2 inch fresh or 1/4 tsp dried), cinnamon (1/4 tsp), cardamom (1 pod), turmeric (1/4 tsp), cumin (1/4 tsp), black pepper (pinch).
Spices.Dont: Excessively pungent, hot, or drying spices that can aggravate Vata and blood sugar. Limit chili peppers and very sour spices.

Leafy veg.Do: Cooked leafy greens like spinach (1/2 cup cooked), kale (1/2 cup cooked), chard (1/2 cup cooked) gently sautéed with ghee or oil. Ensure they are well-cooked.
Leafy veg.Dont: Large amounts of raw leafy greens, especially bitter varieties. Avoid excessive amounts of bitter gourd.

Oil.Do: Warming and nourishing oils like ghee (1-2 tsp), sesame oil (1-2 tsp), olive oil (1-2 tsp). Use for cooking and sautéing.
Oil.Dont: Excessively cold or drying oils. Avoid fried foods cooked in old oil.

Fruits.Do: Sweet, ripe, and grounding fruits like ripe bananas (1 small), cooked apples (1/2), cooked pears (1/2), dates (2-3), figs (2-3).
Fruits.Dont: Sour, astringent, or unripe fruits like raw berries, citrus fruits in excess, pomegranates. Avoid dried fruits without soaking.

Nuts and Dry fruits.Do: Soaked and peeled nuts like almonds (4-6 soaked), walnuts (2-3 halves), and sweet dried fruits like dates (2-3), figs (2-3).
Nuts and Dry fruits.Dont: Large quantities of dry, light, or raw nuts. Avoid unsalted and unroasted nuts in excess.

Milk product.Do: Warm, nourishing dairy like warm whole milk (1/2 cup, preferably organic and grass-fed), small amounts of ghee, and yogurt that is not too sour and consumed at room temperature (1/4 cup).
Milk product.Dont: Cold milk, ice cream, very sour yogurt, hard cheeses. Avoid large quantities of dairy.

Non-veg.Do: Warm, cooked, and easily digestible meats like chicken (3-4 oz cooked), fish (3-4 oz cooked), turkey (3-4 oz cooked). Ensure they are well-cooked and moist.
Non-veg.Dont: Dry, light, or cold meats. Avoid excessive amounts of red meat. Limit fried or heavily processed meats.

Condiments.Do: Mild, warming, and savory condiments like a pinch of sea salt, tamari or soy sauce (low sodium, 1 tsp), a small amount of chutney (not too spicy or sour).
Condiments.Dont: Excessively spicy, sour, salty, or astringent condiments. Avoid vinegar-based sauces and very pungent pickles.
